--- title: Notoma keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Use Notion to write articles for any blogging platform that works with Markdown. Pagify automatically exports your Notion pages into a bunch of `.md` files, available as a CLI tool, or a Python library." description: "Use Notion to write articles for any blogging platform that works with Markdown. Pagify automatically exports your Notion pages into a bunch of `.md` files, available as a CLI tool, or a Python library." ---

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
import sys
sys.path.append('..')

from notoma.core import *
from nbdev.showdoc import *
{% endraw %}

Install

pip install notoma

Basic Usage

Getting the Notion auth token

Pagify uses notion-py to work with Notion's reverse engineered web api. It's not an official API, hence the unorthodox authentication techniques.

notion-py wants an auth token, called token_v2, that you can get from a Cookie on notion.so.

Using Pagify as a standalone app

You can install Pagify and use it as a standalone utility:

pip install notoma

pagify --token=TOKEN --db=URL --dest .

Using from your python code

{% raw %}

notion2md[source]

notion2md(token_v2:str, database_url:str, dest:Union[str, Path])

Grab Notion Blog database using auth token token_v2, convert posts in database database_url to Markdown, and save them to dest.

{% endraw %}
